detail.content: NYU College of Nursing Appoints James C. Pace, PhD, MDiv, ANP, BC, FAANP, FAAN, as Senior Associate Dean for Academic Programs                                                                                                               NYU.edu requires JavaScript be enabled in your browser in order to use important features of the site. Pace, PhD, MDiv, ANP, BC, FAANP, FAAN, as Senior Associate Dean for Academic Programs                   April 17, 2015          N-333 2014-15                                        New York University College of Nursing today announced the appointment of James C. Pace, PhD, MDiv, ANP, BC, FAANP, FAAN, as NYU College of Nursing’s Senior Associate Dean for Academic Programs, effective September 1, 2015. Dr. Pace is currently a Clinical Professor of Nursing and Associate Dean of Undergraduate Programs at the College.    “Jim will bring his robust depth of experience in teaching, mentorship, and academic program administration from his years at NYU, Emory, Vanderbilt, and the University of Alabama, Birmingham to this role,” said Eileen M. Sullivan-Marx, PhD, RN, FAAN, Dean & Erline Perkins McGriff Professor of the College of Nursing. “In particular, Jim’s background and his vision to integrate research, practice, and education locally and globally are an excellent fit for this position in which he will work with faculty, staff, and administration to implement continued and growing excellence and innovation in our academic enterprise.    “Among Jim’s numerous qualifications that made his candidacy stand out during the search process, I was particularly excited by the diversity of his past leadership experience, as well as his highly effective, collaborative, and compassionate leadership style. Jim has forged excellent relationships here at NYU among our clinical partners and the University administration, serving on several University leadership committees.     “I want to thank the Search Committee appointed for this position, Gail D’Eramo Melkus (chair), Ellen Lyons, Ann Kurth, Marilyn Hammer, Janet Van Cleave, Emerson Ea, and Caroline Dorsen. They conducted a rigorous and thorough national search, dedicated many hours, and worked diligently with our faculty and administration, ultimately leading to this highly successful appointment.”     About James C. Pace PhD, MDiv, ANP, BC, FAANP, FAAN:    Dr. Pace is currently the Associate Dean of the Undergraduate Program at the New York University College of Nursing holding the rank of Clinical Associate Professor.    Dr. Pace is a board certified adult nurse practitioner and a Fellow in the American Academy of Nurse Practitioners. His extensive teaching experience spans three decades; he has taught previously at three Schools of Nursing: the University of Alabama at Birmingham, Emory, and Vanderbilt Universities.    Prior to joining the NYU College of Nursing, Dr. Pace was the Director of the Adult Nurse Practitioner/Palliative Care Program at Vanderbilt University. Dr. Pace has held various Nurse Faculty Practice appointments to include working as a nurse practitioner at the Vanderbilt Ingram Cancer Center as well as Evening Chaplain at Vanderbilt University Medical Center.    Dr. Pace’s scholarly interests and activities lie in the areas of spirituality/religion and health, palliative/hospice care, and HIV/AIDS and spirituality. Dr. Pace is also an Episcopal priest who serves the Diocese of New York as an assisting priest at The Church of St. Mary the Virgin, Times Square.     About New York University College of Nursing: NYU College of Nursing is a global leader in nursing education, research, and practice. It offers a Bachelor of Science in Nursing, a Master of Science and Post-Master’s Certificate Programs, a Doctor of Philosophy in Research Theory and Development, and a Doctor of Nursing Practice degree. For more information, visit  https://nursing.nyu.edu /                        This Press Release is in the following Topics:      College of Nursing           Type: Press Release            Press Contact:                Christopher James | (212) 998-6876                                            James C. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service         School of Continuing and Professional Studies         School of Law         School of Medicine         Silver School of Social Work         Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development         Tisch School of the Arts                            Select a Topic             All University         Athletics         Awards         Division of Libraries         Events and Traditions         Institute of Fine Arts         International Houses         Research         nyu alumni magazine                       View articles from:          Through:             Advanced Search                                         NYU In the News   NYU Received a Record Number of Applications   Capital New York reported NYU received a record 60,322 applications for the class of 2019, an increase of about 15 percent since last year.     NYU Students Help City Crack Down on Hookah Bars   Capital New York reported that NYU students helped New York City crack down on hookah bars that illegally include tobacco in their hookahs:     Rudin Center Study Says Mass Transit Helps Economic Mobility   The Wall Street Journal wrote about a report by Wagner’s Rudin Center that showed that mass transit could be more important than education in determining economic mobility.     Brennan Center Report Says Campaign Spending Has Jumped   Frontline did a piece about a report by the Brennan Center for Justice that said that campaign spending by outside groups has more than doubled in the last five years.     NYU’s Dorms Ranked Among the Best in the Nation   Hometalk.com ranked NYU’s student residences third in the country in its list of best college dorms.
